issues.description: Visibility mismatch for PersonResource.createPerson(...) between template and solution. In the template the createPerson handler is declared public (public ResponseEntity<Person> createPerson(...)), while in the solution it is package-private (no access modifier). This is an unintended structural difference in the controller API surface and may confuse students who compare template and solution code or rely on conventional public visibility for controller handler methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the visibility consistent. Preferably declare the createPerson method public in the solution (public ResponseEntity<Person> createPerson(...)) to match the template and common controller conventions, or alternatively make the template method package-private if intentionally chosen. This avoids distracting differences that do not affect the exercise objective.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the REST endpoints with an "/api" prefix (e.g. "PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents"), while both the template and solution controllers expose the endpoints without the "/api" prefix (e.g. @PutMapping("persons/{personId}/parents") resulting in paths like "/persons/{personId}/parents"). This mismatch between the documented endpoint paths and the actual controller mappings can confuse students when they try to call or test the endpoints (they may call /api/..., but the application serves /...), and it makes it harder to map the problem instructions to the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the endpoint paths consistent. Either (A) update the problem statement to refer to the actual paths used in the code (e.g. "PUT /persons/{personId}/parents"), or (B) change the controllers to include the "/api" prefix (for example add @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...) at the class level or adjust each mapping to "/api/persons/..."). Choose the option that matches the intended public API convention for the exercise.
